description: The HpeNetworkDeviceFunction resource describes the Hewlett Packard Enterprise property extensions for Network Device Functions

BootTargetSource.description: Controls the source of boot target parameters for this network device function. This property can only be configured when the network device function is not in the Disabled state.

enumDescriptions.NetworkDeviceFunction: Boot target parameters as configured on this network device function will be used.
enumDescriptions.None: Boot mode is configured disabled, and no target source applies.
enumDescriptions.UEFI: Boot target parameters are under control of UEFI and the device option ROM.  Any target parameters configured on this network device function are ignored.

ConnectionID.description: The Connection ID to be used with EVB, in IETF RFC-4122 UUID format.

NetDevFuncCapabilities.description: Interconnection capabilities of this network device function.

enumDescriptions.Disabled: Neither enumerated nor visible to the operating system.
enumDescriptions.Ethernet: Appears to the operating system as an Ethernet device.
enumDescriptions.FCoE: Appears to the operating system as an FCoE device.
enumDescriptions.FibreChannel: Appears to the operating system as a Fibre Channel device.
enumDescriptions.InfiniBand: Appears to the operating system as an InfiniBand device.
enumDescriptions.RoCE: (Deprecated function type for some adapters, in iLO 1.40+) Appears to the operating system as an RDMA over converged Ethernet device.
enumDescriptions.iSCSI: Appears to the operating system as an iSCSI device.
enumDescriptions.iWarp: (Deprecated function type for some adapters, in iLO 1.40+) Appears to the operating system as an iWarp RDMA device.

NetDevFuncType.description: The presently configured interconnection capability of this network device function.

enumDescriptions.Disabled: This function is disabled, and is neither enumerated nor visible to the operating system.
enumDescriptions.Ethernet: This function is configured to operate as an Ethernet device.
enumDescriptions.FCoE: This function is configured to oeprate as an FCoE device.
enumDescriptions.FibreChannel: This function is configured to operate as a Fibre Channel device.
enumDescriptions.Infiniband: This function is configured to operate as an Infiniband device.
enumDescriptions.RoCE: (Deprecated function type for some adapters, in iLO 1.40+) This function is configured to operate as an RDMA over converged Ethernet device.
enumDescriptions.iSCSI: This function is configured to operate as an iSCSI device.
enumDescriptions.iWarp: (Deprecated function type for some adapters, in iLO 1.40+) This function is configured to operate as an iWarp RDMA device.

SupportedFCBootTargetCount.description: The number of Fibre Channel boot targets supported by this network device function.

VirtualLinkStatus.description: Current status of the EVB Virtual Link (S-Channel) supporting this function.

enumDescriptions.HostDriverDown: SVID is assigned and Virtual Link status is up, but the host OS driver is inactive.
enumDescriptions.NoChannel: Port link is down, or the connected switch has not assigned an SVID.
enumDescriptions.SwitchChannelDown: SVID is assigned but Virtual Link status is down.
enumDescriptions.VirtualLinkUp: SVID is assigned, Virual Link status is up, and the host OS driver is active.

WakeOnLANEnabled.description: Enables Ethernet Wake On LAN (WoL) capability for this function when true.

title: #HpeNetworkDeviceFunction.v1_2_1.HpeNetworkDeviceFunction
